channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for DE

item.title: Report E-2023020541
item.description:
Report E-2023020541

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-12T12:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-07
  • City: SEAFORD
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XSA experienced a UN3066 "SeaShield 550 Epoxy Grout" release from (2) 3-gallon metal pails to the trailer floor due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractor to assist with cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 1' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged pails, impacted cardboard, and cleanup debris were then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023020217
item.description:
Report E-2023020217

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-11T21:08:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-10
  • City: Dover
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Eagle Transport Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Our driver made a wide right turn onto an access road behind the store to make delivery. As he did so, his trailer was struck by a passenger vehicle. The trailerâ€™s #5 discharge head and fitting box were damaged. The discharge head damage resulted in the loss of approx. 14 gals of RUL onto the paved surface of the access road. There was no impact to the soil or water, but Dover FD personnel dispersed oil-dry to contain the released product. Product came from the wet lines only. The vessel was not compromised.

item.title: Report E-2022070566
item.description:
Report E-2022070566

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-11T21:08:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-13
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX CUSTOM CRITICAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While at the shipper on 07/13/2022, the driver was told when she inquired that the freight was not hazmat. The driver was not allowed on the dock during loading and when she went in the cargo box to secure the freight there were no hazmat markings or labels visible. When the freight delivered on 07/14/2022, the driver was on the dock area while the freight was offloaded and saw that there were hazmat markings and labels on the freight. She further noticed that all remaining freight in the cargo box was loaded so that the side with the hazmat markings and labels loaded to be facing the sidewalls of the cargo box which would prevent her from seeing the hazmat details. She took photos of the freight and those were escalated to me in the Safety department. The shipment was booked as non-hazardous, so I contacted the shipper to see if there was some special exemption that allowed the freight to move without shipping paperwork since I did not see any that applied to the proper shipping name that appeared on the freight. The shipper instead provided me with a copy of the shipper's declaration of dangerous goods that should have accompanied the shipment during transportation.

THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER W97Y63, SAFE GUARD 19, 129 AMBER SKY, IRVINE CA 92618.
